lead_paragraph: In response to a Freedom of Information Act request by the New York Times, the Department of Justice has released three batches of letters it sent to lawmakers on congressional oversight committees between 2011 and 2013. The letters cover a wide variety of topics, including enforcement of civil rights laws, leak investigations, antitrust matters, spending on conferences, and criminal prosecutions.

headline.main: Justice Department Releases Letters to Congress
